name: wnotes

screenshots.caption: Wnote are resizable, collapsable, and configurable.  You can make the notes float above or below other windows, and collapse and expand them.  Optionally, you can save the note to a file and re-open it later on.

short_description:
WNotes are flexible, convenient notes for Linux and UNIX desktops.  They are self contained and can work with shells like bash and zsh, and any other scripting language, so you can write versatile, visual text applications with them, or simply pop up a note whenever you need one.
WNotes are written using GNU C++ and use Xlib for Linux and UNIX, so they should be easy to install on any system that supports GCC and the X Window System.
summary: Text Notes for Linux and UNIX Desktops
